author: edwint
title: World of Pirates
description: Los jugadores quieren participar en todos los aspectos del juego que les gusta jugar, tener impacto en la sociedad y controlar sus activos en el juego. [1]

f6_assessments.q0:
Creo que soy competente para evaluar esta propuesta, ya que he participado activamente en el proyecto Catalyst desde el fondo 4 y tengo experiencia en el análisis de los requisitos de negocio de más de 5 años de entrega de soluciones de software para las pequeñas empresas y las corporaciones también. Aparte de eso, he sido un jugador toda mi vida y también he trabajado como probador de juegos, así que sé un poco sobre la industria.
Aunque el planteamiento del problema no identifica tanto un problema como señala algunas cosas que gustan a los jugadores, podemos entender que la propuesta pretende crear un juego Free to play y Play to earn que daría a los jugadores mucho control sobre sus activos en el juego, les permitiría ganar NFT y también donar a la caridad. Como comentario para el proponente sobre esta parte: si utiliza acrónimos en la declaración inicial de la propuesta, explique lo que significan los términos poco después. No esperes que los votantes conozcan estos términos, ya que muchos de ellos no serán jugadores y algunos no tendrán, en general, muchos conocimientos de tecnología. Además, más adelante en la propuesta, se menciona que los fondos aquí son necesarios para crear el MVP del juego. En mi opinión, esto debería haberse mencionado en la solución, para no confundir a la gente pensando que el resultado esperado es el juego completo.
El resumen del proyecto, tal y como se describe en la sección de descripción del juego, es que será un juego de cartas de ajedrez de tipo battle royale (véase Might & Magic Chess Royale para comparar), en el que las personas juegan unas contra otras para ganar XP (no se detalla el uso de la XP), oro pirata (que se puede utilizar para comprar cofres en el juego, que, cuando se abren, te dan una combinación de fichas WOPRace, cartas NFT u otros activos del juego). Por lo que tengo entendido, estos tokens serán utilizados por mis jugadores, junto con los tokens WOP (que sólo se pueden comprar con ADA / fiat) para luego votar sobre la dirección del juego en el DAO que se establecerá más adelante. Los desarrolladores también planean hacer este juego compatible con AR para ser jugado en el exterior con los teléfonos.
Estoy de acuerdo en que esta propuesta aborda efectivamente el desafío, ya que lo que estamos buscando aquí son buenos juegos para traer a la gente en el ecosistema Cardano. Sin embargo, no puedo dar 5 estrellas porque la propuesta no ha hablado de cuáles son las métricas de éxito, ni cómo será exactamente el MVP y cuáles son los planes para escalar en el futuro. Hay algunas palabras en el libro blanco sobre la sostenibilidad a largo plazo, pero se centran en el hecho de que el juego es Free to Play y son bastante vagas. Habría esperado ver proyecciones concretas para los siguientes meses / años.
f6_assessments.q1:
El proponente ha proporcionado un enlace a la página web del proyecto (https://worldofpirates.io), pero está algo vacío, la verdad. Los nombres y funciones de los 5 miembros del equipo se pueden ver en la sección de la tripulación (/contacto), pero no proporcionan ninguna información que no se mencione ya en la propuesta (función y experiencia anterior). Intenta añadir algunos enlaces sociales en el futuro, por favor, para que cualquiera pueda verificar que son personas reales fácilmente. Me entristece decir que personalmente denuncié una propuesta diferente aquí en Ideascale, porque afirmaba que algunas personas trabajaban para ellos y no era así (me puse en contacto con ellos en LinkedIn y lo confirmaron).
Aparte de esto, otra parte importante que falta es la información sobre cómo se completará este proyecto. No tenemos una hoja de ruta paso a paso, ni un calendario con los resultados esperados después de 3-6-12 meses. Tenga en cuenta que la página https://www.worldofpirates.io/roadmap que usted señala está en blanco. También mencionas que has vendido algunos NFT y los has donado a una organización benéfica, pero el enlace que señalas para obtener detalles también está en blanco: https://www.worldofpirates.io/potm.
La falta de toda esta información que he presentado anteriormente, así como la ausencia de mención de posibles riesgos o impedimentos para el proyecto disminuye gravemente mi confianza en la viabilidad del proyecto.
La única parte que tiene un poco más de detalles es el presupuesto, que está calculado para los siguientes 3 meses (el tiempo que los proponentes consideran que les llevará crear el MVP). Las cifras parecen bastante creíbles, aunque un poco elevadas (4.000 dólares al mes por desarrollador y 3.000 al mes por vendedor, lo que supone un total de 53.000 dólares en salarios, mientras que sólo se estiman 1.200 dólares en costes de publicidad). Después de sumar también los costes con la infraestructura, el total asciende a 60.000 dólares. De nuevo, son cifras creíbles, pero un poco elevadas en mi opinión para un proyecto indie que quiere empezar. Entiendo que la gente del equipo tiene mucha experiencia, pero tal vez quieras considerar buscar fuentes de financiación adicionales también, ya que no estoy seguro de que Catalyst por sí solo pueda cubrir todo lo que necesitas de fondo a fondo.
Para recapitular la viabilidad, los proponentes no proporcionaron enlaces para verificar la experiencia del equipo, varios enlaces en su sitio al que se refieren son sólo páginas en blanco, no hay hoja de ruta o plazos, excepto por la mención de que el MVP tomará 3 meses para completar y me parece que el presupuesto es bastante alto para una cantidad tan corta de tiempo para un proyecto indie. Basándome en los datos anteriores, no estoy de acuerdo en que esta propuesta tenga posibilidades de llevarse a cabo con éxito.
f6_assessments.q2:
Como se ha descrito anteriormente, la propuesta es lo suficientemente clara en el sentido de que quiere crear un MVP para un juego de cartas de ajedrez de tipo battle royale Free to Play, pero le faltan muchos detalles sobre cómo lo hará. En el futuro, por favor, añada detalles sobre cuál será el enfoque y cuáles son los entregables en determinados intervalos (trate de pensar en una línea de tiempo para su proyecto con hitos para las marcas de 3, 6 y 12 meses). Además, para que los proyectos sean auditables, se necesitan indicadores clave de progreso más detallados. Por el momento, la propuesta sólo menciona que después de poner en marcha tus páginas sociales el 04.12.2021, conseguiste 300 miembros en Discord, 100 seguidores en Twitter, etc., pero Project Catalyst necesita poder seguir tu progreso en el futuro. Para ello, habría sido útil establecer objetivos claros, como por ejemplo "1000 seguidores en Twitter después de un mes de la primera campaña publicitaria, 60% de NFT's acuñados vendidos después del lanzamiento del MVP, un video de youtube por mes que siga la actualización del proyecto, etc".
En resumen, esta propuesta tiene mucha ambición, parece bastante claro en el libro blanco que el equipo ha puesto mucho esfuerzo en esta idea y creo que si logran poner en marcha la bola de nieve tienen una oportunidad de éxito, pero faltan muchas piezas importantes de información que Catalyst necesita, como he señalado anteriormente.
Por el momento, no estoy ni de acuerdo ni en desacuerdo con que la información aquí presente sea suficiente para auditar el éxito de la propuesta.

f6_assessments.q0: Overall, this proposal addresses the challenge posed. Gamers no longer spend time and money on video games in vain. Instead, they can profit in the long run from playing the game. Besides, the game has great meaning, it helps to create motivation to help our ocean.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team consists of many experts with experience working in different fields, which makes the implementation of the idea much easier. In particular, 3 people on the team are pioneers of Plutus, which is an advantage.
I have read your plan, the route is quite reasonable. However, you have only designed the website of the game, the game interface will not be released until 2022, as you know, gamers attach great importance to interface issues.
f6_assessments.q2:
You mentioned this is a card game, and I think card games can't support AR, if possible you should clarify how AR fits into this game.
I visited your website, but can't see the interface of the game. If the game is released earlier, I think it will bring a more intuitive view for users. I think you should allow users to try it out to experience.
Should be more clear on the Play To Earn aspect.
f6_assessments.reply:
You nailed the Impact section. For the second section (Feasibility) you are right at that moment we didn't had a final ui for the game, we will present something at IdeaFest, but nevertheless this will be an iterative process and we will work with users and based on their feedback we will adjust the ui and come with something sutiable.
Adressing the AR part, currently is just in the idea/vision phase, we have some ideas on how we can implement that, but it's true that we have to do some research and test to come with a prototype. About our website, we currently focus on the characters, universe and the NFT part, but the website is a creature itself and it will evolve in the next months once we will focus more on the game MVP and next versions this will be reflected in the website too.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is very well presented both in ideascale and in the recent ideafest presentation. Clearly a lot of thought has gone into the theme and gameplay through Free and Pay-2-earn scenarios, but also how best to utilise the blockchain functionality , incorporating NFT trading, NFT creation & an off chain DAO for artists. There are multiple avenues into this game so should appeal to a large demographic thus aligning with the key objectives of the challenge. More user, transitions, games on Cardano.
Interest is already being shown. 100 twitter followers quite in the proposal, this is now pass 300.
f6_assessments.q1:
The roadmap on the website is great and provides very high level view of the next two years. However for this specific proposal, which is developing an MVP, it is not particularly clear what the steps involved are to achieve the MVP. The proposal really needs a plan vs budget vs deliverables vs milestones to provide confidence in feasibility. At the moment the voter is placing trust in the proposer based on a the website work done to date. This is a simple fix for the proposer, they need to due the due diligence on feasibility and i would suggest they reach out to a project manager/mentor to help with future proposals or presentations to a VC.
A number of people are named in the proposal but it is not clear if these are actually going to be part of the delivery team. In addition resource profiles are not provided in the proposal or on the website.
The is a basic budget breakdown. Senior developer cost of $4000 per month. These are sensible assuming the named resource are simply taking this as their permanent salary and they do not need to engage contract resource which could cost significantly more.
On the basis of what i have seen from the ideafest video only have confidence to give this 3 stars.
There is a note about recruiting marketing and sales people. This is also a key risk to the project. Mitigation is either a very steep learning curve for the current team or a potential increase in costs if they need to engage a 3rd party organisation to help for example.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is difficult to assess as not key metrics or KPI's are given. The key question is how can we measure that the MVP is successful? The proposer should think about measuring community feedback on the MVP and develop some targets to check themselves against.

f6_assessments.q0:
It's a good nft game plan on cardano blockhain written well and clear. 
It talks about a 50% donation to sea shepard but it is not specified how it will happen. At the link given I can't find specific information. I noted that the proposal justifies this as not yet provable in advance and will be proven later. This is a red flag for me.
f6_assessments.q1:
I read the whitepaper and it is well written.
However, it lacks specific details, 6 pages is perhaps too little.
Some of the team we can look up on linkedin and they all have experience in the field of games and blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: I don't see a detailed plan. Milestones are missing and I would have liked a github repo to track work.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers want to introduce the game World of pirates which is a chess-like game. The game would be P2E and with the earned tokens the player is able to engage in the community and buy in-game chests for rewards. At its core, this proposal fits well within the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Looking at the team's experience, they seem more than qualified for this project. They provide the necessary skills required on their website. Concerning the rest of this proposal, I see some inconsistencies. The proposers talk about two tokens (WOP and WOPR) while in the whitepaper they talk about three(PG, WOPR, and others). in the whitepaper, there is no mention of the WOP token which can be bought with ADA or FIAT. The roadmap provided is sound and secure. The budget request is more than sufficient for the proposal, although it is a bit on the high-end. Because of the inconsistency, I'll remain neutral on this.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided remains rudimental for the proposal. the proposal is for one step within the global roadmap and the proposers don't provide us with milestones within these three months. The KPIs that are mentioned by the proposers refer to the marketing of this proposal, which is perfect for the stage this is in right now. I personally would've liked some milestones that go deeper into the development of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a game combining chess and NFTs. It has classical chess mode and a battle royale that includes the champion NFTs. I think it's an amazing idea and a proposal to match. I really like the idea of it, as a chess player myself I would try this game out for sure. There's a clear way to add value to the cardano ecosystem through leveraging NFTs and the blockchain integration into the game. I love that this project has well through out KPIs and metrics. That's something I'm missing in some of the other proposals. The team has thought about possible future challenges and how to overcome them and is listening to what the community has to say. To be honest, I don't see anything missing from this proposal. I think it's a great idea with a great team behind it to back it up.  As a developer, I don't see any issues with the team credentials. Overall should be a great game given the described work is put in the next year. Good luck!
f6_assessments.q1: I was able to verify the credentials and skills of the listed people in the proposal. I have no doubt these people will be able to deliver on the game as described in the proposal. The team members count as well as types and specific skills required is clear and that gives me great confort in the success of this proposal. The budget is clear enough and is broken down into understandable parts that are easy to follow. As a developer myself, the roadmap and time frame seem reasonable for the work that needs to be done which shows that the team members have no problem estimating the tasks ahead.  All resources linked in the proposal are relevant and further explain details like how the future process and charity work will be done. The idea is to have royalties from the NFT sales got to charity which is noble. I love the proposers have shown the economic incentives for the players to go on their platform and are not just hoping but have a plan in mind to build a community. Risks and challenges are mentioned in the proposal and have well explained plan of action.  Overall I think the game is feasible and I'd play it.
f6_assessments.q2: Should have no problem with tracability and auditability. The team has an active telegram discord and twitter channels so they'll be able to bring any community members along for the ride while the development is ongoing. Strong KPIs and metrics that would allow community members to follow the success of the project. A clear roadmap and milestones are present in the proposal. The description and problem statements are understandable and well put together. I love the charity cause as well.   I love the proposal and it surely will be a great addition to the ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely Gamers want to be involved in every aspect of the game they love to play, to have impact in society and to control their in-game assets but in most games they cannot
 
This proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by creating an interactive NFT game to bring gamers into the Cardano Ecosystem. It will also introduce kids to Play to Earn as well as NFT related Social Causes. It will bring chess players as well as card gamers into this space.
 
This proposal shows clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System by bringing many different types of new users. 
 
Key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly namely 300 Members on Discord, 100 followers on Twitter, 50 Members on Telegram, 70 Users registered on our website that they verified their wallets too 

Key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to complete the project. 
 
 
These links are sufficient 
 
 
I have visited these links and contacted the relevant people
 
 
I have been able to assess their level of competence.They have a high level of competence.

 
The proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal. THe skills of the team has been clearly laid out along with their experience and history. 

The budget has been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items
 
The budget is reasonable to achieve the set goals 
THey have considered many different aspects, including how to create unique NFTS, increase player participation and ongoing engagement through Pawn of the Month competitions and such unique engagements. They also have the chance to get high value NFTs.
 

The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal
 

The proposal offers a very realistic timetable to complete the work

 
 The proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done. All details have been provided as required 
They have considered both the gaming aspects, the NFT aspects and the Social Value by creating a connection with Sea Shepherd. 

 
 The plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal.
 
The proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation.

 
The proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation
f6_assessments.q2:
There is clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement
 
There are clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal
These include 300 Members on Discord, 100 followers on Twitter, 50 Members on Telegram, 70 Users registered on our website that they verified their wallets too 
 
There is a clear understandable description of the targeted problem

There is a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem
 
The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties

f6_assessments.q0: Firstly, the attached website is very good. It is quite complete, both in terms of content and design. We have a lot of information about the project, and we can get to know it in an attractive way. Now talking about the idea itself: this proposal fits perfectly with the objectives of the challenge. The team intends to create a game that is a mixture of several things: chess, stake pool, NFT and donations to an institution dedicated to activities related to the ocean (here we have the explanation of the name of the game, in addition to the characters, that we can meet in the attached website, being pirates and the game's theme revolve around that). In my opinion, this game has everything to work out, because it already involves something very famous and appreciated - chess - with the minting of NFTs, greatly benefiting the Cardano ecosystem since all this would be done through a pool and also these NFTs could be exchanged for ADA. This would automatically increase the number of transactions on our blockchain, fully matching what we are looking for in the challenge - games that increase ecosystem activities. As a bonus, we could still meet one of Cardano's general objectives, which is to promote sustainability, through the donations made (the authors attach a link that is specifically about this, through which we can better understand this part of the donations). I congratulate the team and hope they are funded.
f6_assessments.q1: 80 years of experience? In this case, the bidders probably added up the years of experience of each one individually to arrive at this number. This did not make me understand the real experience of the group, that is, how old each one is, and in which areas, etc. It is positive, however, that they already have their developers in Plutus, because from what I've noticed many proposals need these professionals but will still hire them. The presentation of the group is perfect - we have a good description of each member, knowing their names, roles and areas of training. The linkedin profiles were also linked, in the end of the proposal. It is also positive how they leave open the possibility of hiring freelancers for design and storytelling areas. That is, in relation to the team, I believe that everything is in order (I was just confused by this story of 80 years of experience). The money asked for funding is also explained very adequately; we know what each small fraction would correspond to for the execution of the project, even though it is a high value (60k) it is quite understandable for the many people who would work here and also the various activities that would take place. It is a large and complex project. The roadmap is attached on a website (https://www.worldofpirates.io/roadmap), I loved the graphic way they organized the steps, really creative and gives us a good understanding of what would be done and in what order. In addition, from what I understand, the idea is to gradually complete the %, that is, in phase 1, they would update: 20% done, 50%... This would even be a way of auditing the proposal, as I will comment on the next topic .
f6_assessments.q2: Through the attached website, we have a well-organized script with a very attractive design. As I was commenting above, with the passage of time they would update how many % of each step had been done, and with that we could monitor the process. However, unfortunately this is the part that is least addressed by the team, because they do not establish KPIs. They don't tell us exactly some goals to be achieved, they don't predict possible challenges to be faced along the way, etc. We weren't helpless, given the great level of detail about what this game is and how it would all work, but I wish the team had paid more attention to how they audited the proposal. I suggest that they review this part, if funded (I hope!) establish ways for the Cardano community to be able to precisely follow, in addition to the development of the project, the partial results that would be obtained.

solution: Con nuestro juego F2P y P2E, ayudamos a los jugadores a tener un impacto en el mundo donando a proyectos de caridad y ganando NFTs para obtener ingresos.
experience: Somos un equipo de 5 personas con 80 años de experiencia en infraestructura y desarrollo web, juegos y blockchain - 3 de nosotros somos Pioneros de Plutus.
